alert.note: Alert for Dauphin; Lebanon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 10:55AM EST until December 20 at 7:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Swatara Creek Near Hershey affecting Dauphin and Lebanon Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swatara Creek near Hershey. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, The right, or north bank begins to overflow. Several roadways upstream of the gage are affected by high water. At 8.0 feet, The right, or north bank overflows. Several roads are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:31 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum creek stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:31 AM EST Tuesday was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The creek has crested and will fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.
